title: docs: draft changelog for 0.6.0
body: I've drafted up the changelog for the upcoming 0.6.0 documenting the current state of its new features and bugfixes.

title: feat(ci): custom steps for other phases
body:
This enables custom CI steps to be inserted into the CI process. These steps run alongside one of the following existing CI tasks:

* plan
* build-local-artifacts
* build-global-artifacts
* host (fka should-publish)

Additional publish-time jobs were already supported.

Implementation note: I expose these to the GitHub CI tooling as strings, but they're parsed from `Config.toml` as a new `JobStyle` enum. Right now the only type of `JobStyle` is `User`, which just wraps a string; I went for this both as an analogue to how we handle publish jobs, and so that we can automatically strip `./` on the way in and add it back on the way out - again like we do with publish jobs. This also gives us freedom to add new builtin jobs to each of these arrays in the future.

After experimenting with some changes here, I think I've concluded we don't want this in `init`. Otherwise, our `toml_edit` code will reformat it into the less pretty syntax:

title: fix(ci): dependency name for append-release
body: This needs to survive one more release before extra-artifacts are available.

title: fix(ci): fail fast if installer is missing
body:
We already use curl's `--fail` to try to propagate failure status, but the non-zero exit gets wiped away by the pipe. The shell only sees the last process in the chain's exit status, and since `sh` receives an empty string - which is a valid `sh` script - it treats it as a success.

I was going to explicitly `set -eo pipefail`, but turns out that explicitly marking the shell as `bash` gets you that; the shell configuration is different between the inferred shell and an explicit `bash` shell. https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#jobsjob_idstepsshell

Fixes #593.

title: feat: set CC/CXX in generic builds
body:
Currently, we don't set `CC` or `CXX` when running generic builds. This is fine most of the time, but for makefile builds we probably want to hint at the makefile which platform-specific compiler should be used.

This respects `CC` and `CXX` from the external environment if set.

title: Support custom github runners (and arm64)
body: Indirectly implements: https://github.com/axodotdev/cargo-dist/issues/324 I really need linux arm64 support soon, so I thought I would give this a shot. I originally had a setting like `arm64-linux-runner` that I would use for linux arm64 triples, but it felt very restrictive. Instead, I went with a `custom-runners` map, that _allows any triple_ to define the runner it wants to use. This is nice. Working in plan/manifest:

title: feat: extra build artifacts
body:
This adds support for specifying arbitrary extra artifacts alongside the primary builds. These artifacts are currently expected to be architecture-independent and are uploaded as their own build artifacts rather than bundled into release tarballs. For example, we can use this to replace our current `append-release` code in to generate and upload the `dist-manifest-schema.json`.

I realized that most of our generic build code is very well-suited to this, so I split the existing generic builds into half. The code that runs the builds is now shared between this and the generic build path, while another section is separate for implementation detail reasons. There are two main distinctions between these and generic builds:

* Generic builds are oriented around *binaries*, which will eventually be collated into an artifact. Extra artifacts produce artifacts directly, and have no associated binaries.
* Generic builds (usually) build native code and have target triples; as a result, we get N copies of the generic build, one per desired triple. Extra artifacts do not have target triples, and we produce a single copy per release.

The syntax looks like this:

```toml
[[workspace.metadata.dist.extra-artifacts]]
artifacts = ["dist-manifest-schema.json"]
build = ["cargo", "dist", "manifest-schema", "--output=dist-manifest-schema.json"]
```

There can be arbitrary numbers of extra artifacts per build, so this is repeatable within a `Cargo.toml`/`dist.toml` as many times as needed.

Closes #349.

body:
This adds a new global artifact kind: source tarballs. This ensures that a stable tarball gets added to releases, wherever those are hosted. They're generated using `git archive`, so they're semantically equivalent to GitHub's auto-generated tarballs (but not byte-for-byte identical).

Do we want to be able to turn this off, or always have it on?

~~The tests are currently failing because we don't actually have access to the appropriate git tags to run the archives. I should probably try to get us to skip the source for that.~~ Fixed by updating the tests to fetch tags.

body: depends on https://github.com/axodotdev/axocli/pull/19

title: feat: add a comment about Axo Releases beta
feat: cleanup github releases / ci contents
body:
Kind of a grab-bag:

* rename tasks to match the conceptual model now that it's real
  * should-publish => host
  * announce-release/publish-release => announce
* clean up comments, add another test
* create an empty Release for a library-release, allowing everything to know it should be hosted/published/announced
  * in theory this means library-releases to axo hosting should Now Work, but, not yet tested
* github Releases now get the pretty Release urls from axo hosting
  * when performing `host --steps=release` we will update the artifact download urls with the result
    * only the axodotdev url will be updated, if github hosting also is enabled it will still refer to the github release
    * but we prefer the axodotdev url in multi-host-drifting so that's mostly academic
    * we also will find-and-replace the artifact download url in all install_hints
    * we will also regenerate the github releases announcement body to include the new hints
  * in CI we now save the dist-manifest at the end of the host job (which includes `--steps=release`)
    * it is written back to scratch storage (but *not* persistent storage on Abyss, which is logically Frozen at that point)
      * this propagates the updated URLs to announce/publish steps
      * this is actually technically Useless in the current impl but I'm sure we'll want it later so let's just do it now 
    * it is saved to an output of the host step in the same way the dist-manifest of "plan" is
  * in CI we now have the github announcement read from `host.val` instead of `plan.val` to get the new release notes
* PR includes prereleases 7, 8, and 9 for testing

title: Remove rust-toolchain-version from the workspaces setup guide
body:
We should not mention `rust-toolchain-version` in the setup guide since cargo-dist has not generated this field since 0.1.0
However it remains documented as a deprecated config in the reference at https://opensource.axo.dev/cargo-dist/book/reference/config.html#rust-toolchain-version

0.12.0

Breaking

  • Made take_while_inclusive consume iterator by value (#709)
  • Added Clone bound to Unique (#777)

Added

  • Added Itertools::try_len (#723)
  • Added free function sort_unstable (#796)

title: Add release notes for v0.4.3
body:
This was in #556, which was a backport release feature btanch, so we never actually merged it.

fixes #562

title: Add support for Linuxbrew
body:
First pass at adding Linuxbrew support.

Use `on_macos`/`on_linux` and `on_arm`/`on_intel` as Homebrew stanzas instead of `Hardware::CPU.type`

Update insta snaps.

Fixes #501

title: docs(generic): begin generic build docs
body: This is the start of our generic build documentation. While this covers all of the essential configuration, we may want the surrounding text to be more substantive. We also want to decide what this feature is actually called, because "generic builds" is probably not the best name.

title: feat(installer): add additional shell config
body:
~/.profile isn't sourced in many circumstances; we need to write this to a large number of locations to make sure it gets considered by bash and zsh under the largest number of circumstances.

Fixes #547.

title: fix(homebrew): reimplement Homebrew class code
body:
We previously depended on an external crate, but its implementation wasn't 100% identical to Homebrew's. This replaces that with a custom function that implements Homebrew's logic precisely, along with a test case that covers all of Homebrew's test cases plus the two recently reported bugs.

Fixes #541.
Fixes #551.

title: feat: enable generic builds
body:
This PR adds a new "generic" build type. Most of the process is identical to Cargo builds, but I've extended our build logic to add a new `GenericBuildStep` that encapsulates a large part of the different behaviour.

This is an MVP, and it's missing some features we likely want to see in the future:

* Only workspaces are supported; we don't have a concept of packages yet. Since we don't inherit anything like that from Cargo, we'll have to think about what this looks like.
* The user has to manually specify all of the binaries that the build output will contain, since we don't have Cargo to get that information from. In the future, we probably want to make these globs instead of literal paths so that we can accommodate more complex builds.

We defer most of the project loading and parsing logic to axoproject, like we do with Cargo projects.

Depends on https://github.com/axodotdev/axoproject/pull/45 being in a release before this is mergeable.

Draft until we have a new axoproject release.

Closes #534.

title: chore(deps): bump dialoguer from 0.10.4 to 0.11.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [dialoguer](https://github.com/console-rs/dialoguer) from 0.10.4 to 0.11.0.
Changelog

Sourced from dialoguer's changelog.

0.11.0

Enhancements

  • Added dialouger::Result and dialouger::Error
  • Added a BasicHistory implementation for History
  • Added vim mode for FuzzySelect
  • All prompts implement Clone
  • Add handling of Delete key for FuzzySelect

Bug fixes

  • Resolve some issues on Windows where pressing shift keys sometimes aborted dialogs
  • Resolve MultiSelect checked and unchecked variants looking the same on Windows
  • Input values that are invalid are now also stored in History
  • Resolve some issues with cursor positioning in Input when using utf-8 characters
  • Correct page is shown when default selected option is not on the first page for Select
  • Fix panic in FuzzySelect when using non-ASCII characters

Breaking

  • Updated MSRV to 1.63.0 due to multiple dependencies on different platforms: rustix, tempfile,linux-raw-sys
  • Removed deprecated Confirm::with_text
  • Removed deprecated ColorfulTheme::inline_selections
  • Prompt builder functions now take mut self instead of &mut self
  • Prompt builder functions now return Self instead of &mut Self
  • Prompt interaction functions now take self instead of &self
  • Prompt interaction functions and other operations now return dialouger::Result instead of std::io::Result
  • Rename Validator to InputValidator
  • The trait method Theme::format_fuzzy_select_prompt() now takes a byte position instead of a cursor position in order to support UTF-8.

title: fix(sysdeps): handle empty Linux packages
body:
We've seen a minor UI issue with Linux dependencies. I anticipated catching the error status output from `dpkg -S` and reacting to that, but we were still getting cases where not finding the package and accidentally returning an empty string as the "package". This checks for that case and properly handles it.

Before this fix, the linkage reporter was giving us outputs like:

```
/path/to/lib ()
```

And with this fix, it looks like:

```
/path/to/lib
```
